subject: Re: [junit] fixture with parameter passed + other things
msgSnippet: ... Are you comparing objects in memory to objects in the database? If so, perhaps you can use this simple template: Customer expected = ..build Customer
messageBody:
Bauduin Raphael wrote:

> Hi,
>
> As a reminder, I'm working on the validation of data migration between
> two database
> schemas.
>
> I have used Hibernate (www.hibernate.org) to map Java objects to my
> two databases and now I'm starting to work on Junit testing.
> With hibernate, it is possible to iterate over objects. My idea is that
> I'll iterate over the "root" object from the source database, and
> compare the data to the destination database. I thought to design
> fixtures to test each instance of object.

Are you comparing objects in memory to objects in the database? If so,
perhaps you can use this simple template:

Customer expected = ..build Customer object in memory
Customer actual = ..retrieve Customer from database
assertEquals(expected, actual)

As for executing the same test with many different sets of data, you
want to use the Parameterized Test Case pattern, which you should be
able to find in the archives of this group.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
